statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Kevin Hervey scored 28 points, Erick Neal hit three crucial 3-pointers to help fuel a second half rally and UT Arlington slipped past Loyola Marymount for an 85-80 win in the season opener for both teams Saturday night.
article.headline: UT Arlington rallies for 85-80 win over Loyola Marymount
article.linkText: UT Arlington rallies for 85-80 win over Loyola Marymount
article.story: ARLINGTON, Texas -- Kevin Hervey scored 28 points, Erick Neal hit three crucial 3-pointers to help fuel a second half rally and UT Arlington slipped past Loyola Marymount for an 85-80 win in the season opener for both teams Saturday night. Trailing by as much as 12 in the second half, UT Arlington steadily chipped away and got a 3 from Neal to trim the gap to 62-61 with 6:57 left and stayed close. Neal then hit another 3 to break a 71-all tie and gave the Mavericks their first lead of the game. Loyola Marymount's James Batemon hit a jumper to trim it to 74-73, but Neal responded with another 3-pointer to push the advantage to four with 3:07 left and UT Arlington held on from there. Neal finished with 14 points and 11 assists, while Kaelon Wilson and Johnny Hamilton added 13 point apiece for the Mavericks, who shot 54 percent from the field (14-26) in the second half and were 8 for 14 from long range. Batemon led four Loyola Marymount players in double figures with 23 points on 6-for-12 shooting, with 10 of 12 from the free throw line.
